Lobsters: on the other hand, do not exhibit biological immortality and can die from old age.
Biological immortality: as defined by scientists, does not mean that organisms will never die. Instead, it refers to organisms that do not die from senescence or natural aging but can still be killed by external factors such as predators, diseases, or environmental changes.
